jam.io.hdf
Class HDFIO

java.lang.Object
  jam.io.hdf.HDFIO
All Implemented Interfaces:
DataIO, JamHDFFields
public class HDFIO
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataIO, JamHDFFields

Reads and writes HDF files containing spectra, scalers, gates, and additional useful information.

Since:
JDK1.1
Version:
0.5 November 98
Author:
Dale Visser

writeFile

public void writeFile(boolean wrthis,
                      boolean wrtgate,
                      boolean wrtscalers)
Writes out the currently held spectra, gates, and scalers, subject to the options given. (Parameters are always written.)

Specified by:
writeFile in interface DataIO
Parameters:
wrthis - if true, Histograms will be written
wrtgate - if true, Gates will be written
wrtscalers - if true, scaler values will be written

writeFile

public void writeFile(boolean wrthis,
                      boolean wrtgate,
                      boolean wrtscalers,
                      boolean wrtparameters)
Writes out the currently held spectra, gates, and scalers, subject to the options given .

Parameters:
wrthis - if true, Histograms will be written
wrtgate - if true, Gates will be written
wrtscalers - if true, scaler values will be written
wrtparameters - if true, parameter values will be written

writeFile

public void writeFile(boolean wrthis,
                      boolean wrtgate,
                      boolean wrtscalers,
                      java.io.File file)
Writes out (to a specific file) the currently held spectra, gates, and scalers, subject to the options given. Sets separately which data writeFile should actually output. Not writing histograms when you are saving tape data can significantly save time when you have many 2-d spectra. parameters always written

Specified by:
writeFile in interface DataIO
Parameters:
wrthis - if true, Histograms will be written
wrtgate - if true, Gates will be written
wrtscalers - if true, scaler values will be written

writeFile

public void writeFile(boolean wrthis,
                      boolean wrtgate,
                      boolean wrtscalers,
                      boolean wrtparameters,
                      java.io.File file)
Writes out (to a specific file) the currently held spectra, gates, and scalers, subject to the options given. Sets separately which data writeFile should actually output. Not writing histograms when you are saving tape data can significantly save time when you have many 2-d spectra.

Parameters:
wrthis - if true, Histograms will be written
wrtgate - if true, Gates will be written
wrtscalers - if true, scaler values will be written
wrtparameters - if true, parameter values will be written

Returns:
true if successful, false if not
